00003 =head1 NAME
00004 
00005     Circle
00006 
00007 =head1 SYNPOSIS
00008 
00009     use Carp;
00010     use GD;
00011     use WWPlot;
00012     use Fun;
00013 
00014 
00015 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00016 
00017 This module defines a circle which can be inserted as a stamp in a graph (WWPlot) object.
00018 
00019 =head2 Command:
00020 
00021     $circle_object = new Circle( $center_pos_x, $center_pos_y, $radius, $border_color, $fill_color);
00022 
00023 
00024 =head2 Examples:
00025 
00026     Here is the code used to define the subroutines open_circle
00027     and closed_circle in PGgraphmacros.pl
00028 
00029         sub open_circle {
00030             my ($cx,$cy,$color) = @_;
00031             new Circle ($cx, $cy, 4,$color,'nearwhite');
00032         }
00033 
00034         sub closed_circle {
00035             my ($cx,$cy, $color) = @_;
00036             $color = 'black' unless defined $color;
00037             new Circle ($cx, $cy, 4,$color, $color);
00038         }
00039 
00040     $circle_object2 = closed_circle( $x_position, $y_position, $color );
00041 
00042     @circle_objects = $graph -> stamps($circle_object2);
00043     # puts a filled dot at ($x_position, $y_position) on the graph -- using real world coordinates.
00044 
00045 =cut
00046

00048 BEGIN {
00049     be_strict(); # an alias for use strict.  This means that all global variable must contain main:: as a prefix.
00050 }

00052 package Circle;

00070 sub new {
00071     my $class           = shift;
00072     my $cx              = shift;
00073     my $cy              = shift;
00074     my $radius          = shift;    # radius is in pixels, others are in real world coordinates
00075     my $border_color    = shift;
00076     my $fill_color      = shift;
00077     $radius =4 unless defined $radius;
00078     $border_color       =   'black' unless defined($border_color);
00079     $fill_color         =   'black' unless defined($fill_color);
00080 
00081     my $self = { im         =>  new GD::Image(2*$radius, 2*$radius),
00082                  cx         =>  $cx,
00083                  cy         =>  $cy,
00084                  radius     =>  $radius,
00085                  border_color   =>  $border_color,
00086                  fill_color     =>  $fill_color,
00087 
00088     };
00089 
00090     bless $self, $class;
00091     $self ->    _initialize_colors;
00092     if (defined($self->{'colors'}{$border_color} ) ) {
00093         $self->{'border_color'} = $self->{'colors'}{$border_color};
00094     } else {
00095         $self->{'border_color'} = 'default_color';
00096     }
00097     if (defined($self->{'colors'}{$fill_color} ) ) {
00098         $self->{'fill_color'} = $self->{'colors'}{$fill_color};
00099     } else {
00100         $self->{'fill_color'} = 'nearwhite';
00101     }
00102     $self->im->transparent($self->{'colors'}{'background_color'});
00103     $self->im->arc($radius,$radius,2*$radius,2*$radius,0,360,$self->{'border_color'} );
00104     $self->im->fill($radius,$radius,$self->{'fill_color'});
00105     return $self;
00106 }
00107 
00108 sub _initialize_colors {
00109     my $self            = shift;
00110         # allocate some colors
00111         $self->{'colors'}{'background_color'}   =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,255,255);
00112         $self->{'colors'}{'default_color'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(0,0,0);
00113         $self->{'colors'}{'white'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,255,255);
00114         $self->{'colors'}{'black'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(0,0,0);
00115         $self->{'colors'}{'red'}    =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,0,0);
00116         $self->{'colors'}{'green'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(0,255,0);
00117         $self->{'colors'}{'blue'}   =   $self->im->colorAllocate(0,0,255);
00118         $self->{'colors'}{'yellow'} =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,255,0);
00119         $self->{'colors'}{'orange'} =   $self->im->colorAllocate(255,100,0);
00120         $self->{'colors'}{'gray'}   =   $self->im->colorAllocate(180,180,180);
00121         $self->{'colors'}{'nearwhite'}  =   $self->im->colorAllocate(254,254,254);
00122 
00123 }

00129 sub size {
00130     my $s = shift;
00131     (2*$s->{radius}, 2*$s->{radius});
00132 }
00133 sub height{
00134     my $s = shift;
00135     2*$s->{radius};
00136 }
00137 sub width {
00138     my $s = shift;
00139     2*$s->{radius};
00140 }
00141 sub radius {
00142     my $s = shift;
00143     $s->{radius};
00144 }
00145 sub x {
00146     my $s = shift;
00147     $s->{cx};
00148 }
00149 sub y {
00150     my $s = shift;
00151     $s->{cy};
00152 }
00153 sub image {
00154     my $s   = shift;
00155     $s->{im};
00156 }

00163 sub colors {
00164     my $self = shift;
00165     my $type = ref($self) || die "$self is not an object";
00166     unless (exists $self->{colors} ) {
00167         die "Can't find colors field in object of class $type";
00168     }
00169     
00170     if (@_) {
00171         return $self->{colors} = shift;
00172     } else {
00173         return $self->{colors}
00174     }
00175 }
00176 
00177 sub border_color {
00178     my $self = shift;
00179     my $type = ref($self) || die "$self is not an object";
00180     unless (exists $self->{border_color} ) {
00181         die "Can't find border_color field in object of class $type";
00182     }
00183     
00184     if (@_) {
00185         return $self->{border_color} = shift;
00186     } else {
00187         return $self->{border_color}
00188     }
00189 }
00190 
00191 sub fill_color {
00192     my $self = shift;
00193     my $type = ref($self) || die "$self is not an object";
00194     unless (exists $self->{fill_color} ) {
00195         die "Can't find fill_color field in object of class $type";
00196     }
00197     
00198     if (@_) {
00199         return $self->{fill_color} = shift;
00200     } else {
00201         return $self->{fill_color}
00202     }

00206 sub draw{
00207     my $self = shift;
00208     my $g = shift;   # the enclosing graph object
00209     my $x = $self->x;
00210     my $y = $self->y;
00211     my $image = $self->image;
00212     my $height = $self->height;
00213     my $width   = $self->width;
00214     $g->im->copy($image,
00215                   ($g->ii($x)) - int($width/2),
00216                   ($g->jj($y)) - int($height/2),
00217                   0,  0,   $width,   $height);
00218 }

00220     # doing nothing about destruction, hope that isn't dangerous
00221 }
